title: Then: Woah, a Highly Mobile Champion - That's A Unique Strength
body:
Now: Not having mobility is considered a weakness.

But, don't worry, it's not League of Mobility yet.

_clearly_.

Advantages with tradeoffs, this is game balance and design 101. At least Riot used to somewhat get it but now they have gone complete ape for whatever reason.

Riot: That's why he needs to have an AoE stun, a 70% slow passive, 70% bonus movespeed passive, bonus % damage, 2 gap-closers, and an escape tool. 


ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME?
...he has one gap-closer. Unless we're counting his E as two separate abilities? Should we complain about the four gapclosers and escapes on Leblanc and Riven? That's twice as many as two!

His E has two parts, the dash and the blink. therefore, it counts as 2.
LeBlanc (I do not say she isn't a problem) has 2 gapclosers- her W and her ult distortion (if she chooses to use it). going back to it doesnt close a gap between you and the enemy unless you are pretty stupid. 
Riven has a fuckton of mobility, and yes, that does mean 4 gapclosers.

Kha'zix has a longer range gapcloser that resets on kill, plus 3-4 slows in a fight and 2-3 more gapclosers. Zed has two gapclosers, easily becoming 3 or more in a fight if he plays well. Fizz has 'three' gap closers(are we counting both activations of E or what) on a low cooldown. Katarina has an instant blink resetting after every kill, master yi has that + untargetability and massive movement speed, Talon has two gap closers, Ahri has four gap closers(counting Q, because of it's large decaying movement speed boost), Fiora has 3 + a large movement speed boost, Nocturne has two(and one is semi-global), Nidalee has two because of the reset on Pounce, Lee Sin has two(ward hops make W a gapcloser), Kassadin has a gap closer on a 2 second cooldown, Xin has two(because of the CDR on his Q), Vi has two.

Ekko is practically immobile compared to a lot of other assassins.
Not to mention he's much better at going in than out.
Really? I guess I'll just press R to get out, heal, and deal tons of damage!

If you're doing damage with R you're not "getting out". He can either deal with having to commit a bit harder than other assassins or sacrifice his largest damage tool to escape. I know which one I'd rather do, personally.

Not having mobility has always been a weakness.

Having mobility used to be a strength. Ashe was the original reason melees were becoming overloaded. They lacked the mobility to stick to an ADC with a permaslow.

Now almost every champion HAS a gapcloser AND CC. It's considered a legitimate weakness to not have it anymore. That's mobility creep, and it's still happening now.

It's always been a legitimate weakness not to have mobility.
Just like it's a legitimate weakness not to have a fuckton of damage.
There are things called trade offs dude

I don't think you understand. The NORM used to be less mobile champions, and therefore having mobility was considered a fairly unique strength. NOW being immobile is a weakness, because having innate mobility is the norm.
And yet, people continually beg for nerfs to Cho'Gath.
Maybe it's because if you get anywhere near him, he kills you.
That's my point. Mobility =/= power. Cho'Gath is Arguably the least mobile guy in the game (one of them at least), yet is amazingly powerful.

> [{quoted}](name=Laughing Fish,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=z3V4jJRF,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-05-28T18:22:52.373+0000)
>
> That's my point. Mobility =/= power. Cho'Gath is Arguably the least mobile guy in the game (one of them at least), yet is amazingly powerful.

Because he's durable as hell and has very strong CC.

Exactly. Mobility is but one form of power. Other forms of power are equally valid. Cho'Gath is not *under*powered simply because he is immobile. And very mobile champions are not *over*powered simply because they are mobile.

No! Guys! This fish is onto something.

If we just overload every immobile champ's damage, tankiness, and CC to the point of absurdity then we will finally have a balanced game.

Thank god for you Laughing Fish! Where would we be without your extreme examples to show the strengths of all immobile champs even when almost all others don't have it?

I agree with you totally that mobility is just one form of power. HOWEVER, there are so many champions that have that mobility plus all the things the non mobile champs have. Mobility is safety, plain and simple. When you combine that mobility with high damage, you get a champion that is low risk/high reward and will ALWAYS be OP. It isn't hard to understand. LB is the poster child for this.
